intro: Acinodendron dolichorrhynchum, commonly known as the long-beaked acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a distinctive elongated calyx. Acinodendron dolichorrhynchum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
